intro: Calyptrogyne kunorum, commonly known as the broadleaf sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a waxy surface, and its structure is adapted to coastal environments. Calyptrogyne kunorum thrives in sandy soils and is often found in mangrove areas or near the shoreline.
